revision.text:
{{notability|org|date=May 2013}} {{Infobox company |name=Ayasdi |logo= |type=Private |founded=2008 |founders = |location=[[Palo Alto, California]] |key_people= [[Gunnar Carlsson]]
(Co-Founder)
[[Gurjeet Singh]]
(CEO & Co-Founder)
[[Harlan Sexton]]
(VP of Research & Co-Founder) |industry= [[Enterprise software]] |products= |revenue= |operating_income= |net_income= |num_employees= 30 (2013) |parent= |services = [[Big Data Analytics]] |subsid= |homepage=[http://www.ayasdi.com/ Ayasdi] |footnotes=As of March 2013. {{cite web|url=http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi-a-big-data-start-up-with-a-long-history/ |title=Ayasdi: A Big Data Start-Up With a Long History |publisher=The New York Times |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} }} '''Ayasdi''' is an enterprise software company that sells big data analytics technology to individuals looking to analyze high dimensional, high volume data sets. Organizations and companies have used Ayasdi to uncover treatment for diseases, professional sports team analysis, pharmaceutical breakthroughs, and more.{{cite web|url=http://venturebeat.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi/#1FPlL7mgRXdxYWOX.99 |title=A cure for cancer? This 'big data' startup says it can deliver |publisher=Venturebeat |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} Ayasdi focuses on applying [[topology]] to data analysis in the areas of [[life sciences]], [[oil & gas]], [[public sector]], [[financial services]], [[manufacturing]], [[retail]], [[telecom]], and [[sports]].{{cite web|url=http://venturebeat.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi/#1FPlL7mgRXdxYWOX.99 |title=A cure for cancer? This 'big data' startup says it can deliver |publisher=Venturebeat |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} ==History== Ayasdi was founded in 2008 by [[Gunnar Carlsson]], [[Gurjeet Singh]], and [[Harlan Sexton]] after 12 years of R&D at [[Stanford University]].{{cite web|url=http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi-a-big-data-start-up-with-a-long-history/ |title=Ayasdi: A Big Data Start-Up With a Long History |publisher=The New York Times |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} During the 12 years of R&D the founders received $1.25 million in [[DARPA]] and [[IARPA]] grants for "high-risk, high-payoff research".{{cite web|url=http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi-a-big-data-start-up-with-a-long-history/ |title=Ayasdi: A Big Data Start-Up With a Long History |publisher=The New York Times |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} In 2012 Ayasdi landed a series A round of funding led by [[Floodgate Capital]] and [[Khosla Ventures]] for $10.25 million.{{cite web|url=http://finance.fortune.cnn.com/2013/01/16/venture-capital-deals-272/ |title=Venture capital deals |publisher=CNNMoney |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} ==Product== Ayasdi Iris allows data experts to run [[topological data analysis]] on [[big data]] sets allowing them to answer unknown data questions.{{cite web|url=http://betakit.com/2013/01/16/ayasdi-comes-out-of-stealth-with-10-25m-to-answer-unknown-data-questions/ |title=Ayasdi Comes Out of Stealth With $10.25M to Anwser Unknown Data Questions |publisher=Betakit |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}} Ayasdi currently has over 20 customers using Iris in industries including oil & gas, financial services, life science, and the public sector.{{cite web|url=http://techcrunch.com/2013/01/16/darpa-backed-ayasdi-launches-with-10m-from-khosla-floodgate-to-uncover-the-hidden-value-in-big-data/ |title=DARPA-Backed Ayasdi Launches With $10M From Khosla, Floodgate To Uncover The Hidden Value In Big Data |publisher=Techcrunch |date=01/16/2013 |accessdate=03/05/2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nature.com/srep/2013/130207/srep01236/full/srep01236.html |title=Extracting insights from the shape of complex data using topology |publisher=Nature |date=09/13/2012 |accessdate=04/01/2013}} ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Business software]] [[Category:Companies based in Palo Alto, California]]
